reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Support the continuation of lifesaving preventive and curative nutrition services in northwest Syria by RRTs

description.narrative: QRCS aims through the proposed project to ensure continuity and increase the coverage of life-saving preventive and curative nutrition services among children under 5 (boys and girls) and PLWs. QRCS has been supporting seven fixed OTPs centers and 6 mobile rapid response teams reported on monthly 4Ws in coordination with nutrition clusters, UN agencies, health directorates, and local stakeholders in which targeted areas are ranked as a high severity according to the HNO 2021 and nutrition cluster reports, at 29 communities including IDPs camps and host communities in Idleb and rural Aleppo. QRCS will continue provision of quality curative and preventative nutrition services through running eight RRTs and deployment of community outreach activities in the targeted areas in Idleb and rural Aleppo, as well as QRCS, will continue to implementing programmatic adjustment in the context of COVID-19 to protect health care providers, mitigate the risk of infection and ensure continuity of life-saving nutrition services as the followings: 1-Continuity of life-saving nutrition services particularly CMAM, micronutrient supplementation, and IYCF-E under guidance for adaptations in the context of COVID-19 through the deployment of eight mobile rapid response teams and each RRT will visit 3-4 communities weekly. 2- RRTs will provide MUAC screening, refer complicated SAM cases and provision of therapeutic for SAM and MAM cased among children 6-59 months and malnourished PLWs as in 29 communities including IDPs camps. 3- Provision of Maternal nutrition and appropriate IYCF-E counselling and messages for pregnant women and mothers. 4- Screen, referral children and PLWs with Medical problems. 5- 16 CHWs and one team leader will conduct community outreach activities promoting IYCF-E, Maternal nutrition, health, and WASH-related topics and massages, and Identify visual signs of abuse/violence against childU5/PLWs during Nutrition screening based on NWS nutrition cluster and TWG recommendations in the context of COVID-19 using additional platforms such as mobile text messages, radio, TV, and social media to protect, promote and support IYCF-E. 6-Distribution of micronutrient supplementary to PLWs and children under 5 based on SoPs and nutrition cluster recommendations. 7-Conduct training on IYCF-E and CMAM programming in the context of COVID-19 for RRTs staff as well as identify visual signs of abuse/violence against childU5/PLWs, referral pathway and COVID-19 pandemic. 8- Roll-out of a family MUAC approach for caregivers, PLW, and family members. 9- QRCS will conduct COVID 19 precaution during implementation through procuring protective personal equipment such as gloves, masks, sterilizers as well as staff will receive training on IPC and precaution measures. Also, QRCS will conduct online awareness sessions and distribute IEC materials via special channels in social media. 10- QRCS will coordinate with nutrition cluster, partners and local councils and coordinate with WASH cluster through the regular coordination between Nut. and WASH clusters if needed. During the project -12 months- period, QRCS will provide supportive supervision and on-job monitoring and training through community health leader, field project coordinator and project management based in Turkey, as well as QRCS, will provide equitable access and quality of nutrition services to the most vulnerable population among 57,395 children under 5 (28,655 boys and 28,740 girls) and 12,320 PLWs reaching 99,090 expected beneficiaries including (55,160 Female and 43,930 Male), with 1,413 disables people, 56,480 displaced population and overburdened and 42,610 host communities. All estimated caseload and a number of targeted beneficiaries determined based on the capacity of QRCS and previous project finding, achievement and results which reported to nutrition cluster via monthly 4Ws (for more information and 4Ws reports see Annexes attached to support document section on GMS

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
